title: Authors and Citation
text: Crhistian Cornejo. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Cornejo C (2022). hydClimR: Downlod Pre-process Satalite climate data hydrological aplications R. R package version 0.15.0, https://github.com/cCornejoR/hydClimR.
code: @Manual{,   author = {Crhistian Cornejo},   title = {hydClimR: Downlod and Pre-process Satalite climate data for hydrological aplications in R},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.15.0},   url = {https://github.com/cCornejoR/hydClimR}, }

what: Download and Pre-Process Satelital and weather stations data in R.
title: Download and Pre-Process Satelital and weather stations data in R.
text: RWeatherTools set functions allow downloading large data sets using parallelization, functions perform processing satellite data, also includes functions generate inputs hydrological models.

title: Download and Pre-Process Satelital and weather stations data in R.
text: can install development version RWeatherTools GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools")  devtools::install_github("cCornejoR/RWeatherTools") library(RWeatherTools)

title: Download and Pre-Process Satelital and weather stations data in R.
text: basic example shows download RAIN4PE data:
code: ## Get the monthly climatology of a stack netcdf and get a gif as well!  shp <- rgdal::readOGR('Data/SHPs/cuenca_mayo.shp') t <- climatology(years_omit = c(2005,2010),                 grid_path = 'Data/GRIDs/prec_diaria.nc',                 main_title.plot = 'Mayo River basin from PISCOpd',                 shapefile = shp,                 star_date = '1981-01-01',                 end_date = '2016-12-01',                 name_out = 'mayo_basin_climatology',                 variable = 'Precipitation (mm)',                 save_GIF = TRUE,                 return_clip = TRUE,                 save_plot = FALSE)

title: Download and Pre-Process Satelital and weather stations data in R.
text: package depends many packages, intention package generate quick functions allow long processes writing code work large satellite datasets. Peru function obtaining information directly SENAMHI, operation still process. now can use functions downloading preprocessing data downloaded following satellites: CMORPH, SM2RAIN data sets, CHIRPS, RAIN4PE, PISCO TERRACLIMATE. continue improve optimization funcitons, now work!

what:
Compute climatology of grid data for a extension area of a shapefile basin,
with the possibility of creating a graph of the climatology and exporting a GIF. — climatology
title:
Compute climatology of grid data for a extension area of a shapefile basin,
with the possibility of creating a graph of the climatology and exporting a GIF. — climatology
text: Compute climatology grid data extension area shapefile basin, possibility creating graph climatology exporting GIF.

title:
Compute climatology of grid data for a extension area of a shapefile basin,
with the possibility of creating a graph of the climatology and exporting a GIF. — climatology
code: climatology(   start_date = "1981-01-01",   end_date = "2016-12-01",   years_omit = NULL,   grid_path = NULL,   name_out = NULL,   dsn = getwd(),   shapefile = NULL,   main_title.plot = "Climatology",   variable = "Precipitation\n(mm)",   save_GIF = TRUE,   save_plot = TRUE,   return_clip = TRUE )

title:
Compute climatology of grid data for a extension area of a shapefile basin,
with the possibility of creating a graph of the climatology and exporting a GIF. — climatology
text: start_date character. Initial date calculation climatology made, introduce 'yyyy-mm-dd'. end_date character. Final date calculation climatology made, introduce 'yyyy-mm-dd'. years_omit numeric. Year Years omited climatology, usefull data extreme years. grid_path Character. Path raster stack netcdf stored. name_out Character. Output name save graphics files, gifs raster stack tif format. dsn chracter. Path output folders files created. shapefile SpatialPolygon. Shapefile make clip return_clip TRUE. main_title.plot character. Title plots. variable character. Name variable compute climatology. save_GIF logical. TRUE returns gif climatology calculate, output extension depend argument return_clip. FALSE create graph visualization. save_plot logical. TRUE returns plot climatology calculate, output extension depend argument return_clip. FALSE create graph visualization. return_clip logical. argument TRUE shapefile NULL, climatology outputs computed returned just shapefile extension. FALSE return climatology original grid data.

title:
Compute climatology of grid data for a extension area of a shapefile basin,
with the possibility of creating a graph of the climatology and exporting a GIF. — climatology
text: grid montlhy mean climatology grid input.

title:
Compute climatology of grid data for a extension area of a shapefile basin,
with the possibility of creating a graph of the climatology and exporting a GIF. — climatology
text: Crhistian Cornejo

title:
Compute climatology of grid data for a extension area of a shapefile basin,
with the possibility of creating a graph of the climatology and exporting a GIF. — climatology
code: if (FALSE) { if(interactive()){ shp <- rgdal::readOGR('Data/SHPs/cuenca_mayo.shp') t <- climatology(years_omit = c(2005,2010),                 grid_path = 'Data/GRIDs/prec_diaria.nc',                 main_title.plot = 'Mayo River basin from PISCOpd',                 shapefile = shp,                 star_date = '1981-01-01',                 end_date = '2016-12-01',                 name_out = 'mayo_basin_climatology',                 variable = 'Precipitation (mm)',                 save_GIF = TRUE,                 return_clip = TRUE,                 save_plot = FALSE)  } }

what: Download SOILGRIDS datasets V2 for a roi area. — donwload_SOILDGRIDS
title: Download SOILGRIDS datasets V2 for a roi area. — donwload_SOILDGRIDS
text: Download SOILGRIDS datasets V2 roi area.

title: Download SOILGRIDS datasets V2 for a roi area. — donwload_SOILDGRIDS
code: donwload_SOILDGRIDS(   path_saved = getwd(),   variables = c("silt", "clay", "sand", "wrb"),   layers = c("0-5cm_mean"),   roi = c(-86, -66, -20, 2) )

title: Download SOILGRIDS datasets V2 for a roi area. — donwload_SOILDGRIDS
text: path_saved character string path directory data save.Default: getwd() variables character string variables want download. Default: c("silt", "clay", "sand", "wrb") layers depth layers. Default: c("0-5cm_mean") roi vector Longitude min. longitude max, latitude min latitude max. Default: c(-86, -66, -20, 2) Peru area.

title: Download SOILGRIDS datasets V2 for a roi area. — donwload_SOILDGRIDS
text: download tifs variables request.

title: Download SOILGRIDS datasets V2 for a roi area. — donwload_SOILDGRIDS
code: if (FALSE) { if(interactive()){  donwload_SOILDGRIDS(path_saved = 'C:/RPackages/hydClimR/usefull_data/SOILSGRID',                      variables = c("silt", "clay", "sand", "wrb"),                      layers = c('0-5cm_mean','5-15cm_mean'))  } }

what: Function to download CHIRPS raster data global on daily and monthly scales. — download_CHIRPS
title: Function to download CHIRPS raster data global on daily and monthly scales. — download_CHIRPS
text: Function download CHIRPS raster data global daily monthly scales.

title: Function to download CHIRPS raster data global on daily and monthly scales. — download_CHIRPS
code: download_CHIRPS(   tres = NULL,   sres = NULL,   years = 1981,   dsn = getwd(),   format = NULL,   cores = parallel::detectCores() - 1,   verbose = FALSE,   roi = c(-86, -66, -20, 2) )

title: Function to download CHIRPS raster data global on daily and monthly scales. — download_CHIRPS
text: tres character. Temporal resolution. "daily" "monthly" sres numeric. Spatial resolution. 0.05 0.25. Note monthly data available resolution 0.05 degrees. years numeric. Years Date(s) want download CHIRPS data. dsn path. Directory want store downloaded data. format character. Download format files. "tif" "netcdf" available. cores numeric. Number cores used download. default, automatically detects many cores computer subtracts 1 prevent slowing . verbose logical. TRUE show task process parallel process. roi numeric. Vector xmax, xmin, ymax, ymin values region subsetting data.

title: Function to download CHIRPS raster data global on daily and monthly scales. — download_CHIRPS
text: https://data.chc.ucsb.edu/products/CHIRPS-2.0/

title: Function to download CHIRPS raster data global on daily and monthly scales. — download_CHIRPS
text: Crhistian Cornejo

title: Function to download CHIRPS raster data global on daily and monthly scales. — download_CHIRPS
code: if (FALSE) { # roi = c(-86,-66,-20,2) # download_CHIRPS(tres = 'daily',sres = 0.25,format = 'tif',years = 2000,roi = roi) }

what: Function to download CMORPH raster data global on daily sacale at 25km. — download_CMORPH
title: Function to download CMORPH raster data global on daily sacale at 25km. — download_CMORPH
text: Function download CMORPH raster data global daily sacale 25km.

title: Function to download CMORPH raster data global on daily sacale at 25km. — download_CMORPH
code: download_CMORPH(   star_date = "1998-01-01",   end_date = "1998-03-01",   dsn = getwd(),   cores = parallel::detectCores() - 1,   verbose = FALSE,   subsetting = TRUE,   roi = c(-86, -66, -20, 2) )

title: Function to download CMORPH raster data global on daily sacale at 25km. — download_CMORPH
text: star_date numeric. Start Date(s) want download CMORPH data. end_date numeric. End Date(s) want download CMORPH data. recommended download least one year. dsn path. Directory want store downloaded data. cores numeric. Number cores used download. default, automatically detects many cores computer subtracts 1 prevent slowing . verbose logical. TRUE show task process parallel process. subsetting logical. TRUE downloaded netcdf's subsetting extension set roi. roi numeric. Vector xmax, xmin, ymax, ymin values region subsetting data.

title: Function to download CMORPH raster data global on daily sacale at 25km. — download_CMORPH
text: Joyce, R. J., J. E. Janowiak, P. . Arkin, P. Xie, 2004: CMORPH: method produces global precipitation estimates passive microwave infrared data high spatial temporal resolution.. J. Hydromet., 5, 487-503.

title: Function to download CMORPH raster data global on daily sacale at 25km. — download_CMORPH
text: Crhistian Cornejo

title: Function to download CMORPH raster data global on daily sacale at 25km. — download_CMORPH
code: if (FALSE) { roi = c(-86,-66,-20,2) download_CMORPH(star_date = '1998-01-01',                 end_date = '1998-12-31',                 roi = roi,                 subsetting = TRUE,                 verbose = FALSE) }

what: Download PISCO grid daily and monthly data and subsetting for a basin extend.#' — download_PISCO
title: Download PISCO grid daily and monthly data and subsetting for a basin extend.#' — download_PISCO
text: Download PISCO grid daily monthly data subsetting basin extend.#'

title: Download PISCO grid daily and monthly data and subsetting for a basin extend.#' — download_PISCO
code: download_PISCO(   var = c("Prec", "PET", "Temp"),   dsn = getwd(),   tres = c("monthly", "daily", "hourly"),   version = "stable",   shp = NULL,   name_roi = NULL )

title: Download PISCO grid daily and monthly data and subsetting for a basin extend.#' — download_PISCO
text: var character. variables downloaded function, c('Prec', 'PET', 'Temp') available. dsn path. Directory want store downloaded data. tres character. Temporal resolution. "daily" "monthly". version character. now just 'stable' version available. shp Path shapefile alocate. Keep NULL download hourly data. name_roi character. Name area basin subsetting grid done.

title: Download PISCO grid daily and monthly data and subsetting for a basin extend.#' — download_PISCO
text: Aybar, C., Fernández, C., Huerta, ., Lavado, W., Vega, F., & Felipe-Obando, O.G. (2019). Construction high-resolution gridded rainfall dataset Peru 1981 present day. Hydrological Sciences Journal, 65, 770 - 785.

title: Download PISCO grid daily and monthly data and subsetting for a basin extend.#' — download_PISCO
text: Crhistian Cornejo

title: Download PISCO grid daily and monthly data and subsetting for a basin extend.#' — download_PISCO
code: if (FALSE) { ## donwloading data and subsetting for PISCO var <- c('Prec', 'PET', 'Temp') shp <- 'G:/Mi unidad/MyPackages-R/getSPPs/test/SHPs/cuenca_mayo.shp' download_PISCO(var = var[1], dsn = getwd(), shp = shp, tres = 'monthly', version = 'stable') }

what: Download available data for PERÚ at 0.1 x 0.1 resolution of grid and subsetting to a roi area if require. — download_RAIN4PE
title: Download available data for PERÚ at 0.1 x 0.1 resolution of grid and subsetting to a roi area if require. — download_RAIN4PE

what: Function to download SM2RAIN global netcdf datasets on daily sacale. — download_SM2RAIN

title: Function to download SM2RAIN global netcdf datasets on daily sacale. — download_SM2RAIN
code: download_SM2RAIN(   dsn = getwd(),   data_set = c("SM2RAIN-ASCAT", "GPM+SM2RAIN", "SM2RAIN-CCI"),   years = 2007,   cores = parallel::detectCores() - 1 )

title: Function to download SM2RAIN global netcdf datasets on daily sacale. — download_SM2RAIN
text: dsn character. Path output folders files created. data_set character. SM2RAIN data sets available download: c('SM2RAIN-ASCAT','GPM+SM2RAIN','SM2RAIN-CCI'). SM2RAIN-ASCAT data available 2007-2021, GPM+SM2RAIN data available 2007-2018, SM2RAIN-CCI data available 1998-2015, years numeric. Years Date(s) want download data. cores numeric. Number cores used download. default, automatically detects many cores computer subtracts 1 prevent slowing .

title: Function to download SM2RAIN global netcdf datasets on daily sacale. — download_SM2RAIN
text: Brocca, L., Filippucci, P., Hahn, S., Ciabatta, L., Massari, C., Camici, S., Schüller, L., Bojkov, B., Wagner, W. (2019). SM2RAIN-ASCAT (2007–2018): global daily satellite rainfall ASCAT soil moisture, Earth Syst. Sci. Data Discuss., https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-2019-48, review. Brocca, L., Ciabatta, L., Massari, C., Moramarco, T., Hahn, S., Hasenauer, S., Kidd, R., Dorigo, W., Wagner, W., Levizzani, V. (2014). Soil natural rain gauge: estimating global rainfall satellite soil moisture data. Journal Geophysical Research, 119(9), 5128-5141, doi:10.1002/2014JD021489. Wagner, W., Hahn, S., Kidd, R., Melzer, T., Bartalis, Z., Hasenauer, S., Figa, J., de Rosnay, P., Jann, ., Schneider, S., Komma, J., Kubu, G., Brugger, K., Aubrecht, C., Zuger, J., Gangkofner, U., Kienberger, S., Brocca, L., Wang, Y., Bloeschl, G., Eitzinger, J., Steinnocher, K., Zeil, P., Rubel, F. (2013). ASCAT Soil Moisture Product: Review Specifications, Validation Results, Emerging Applications. Meteorologische Zeitschrift, 22(1), 5-33, doi:10.1127/0941-2948/2013/0399.

title: Function to download SM2RAIN global netcdf datasets on daily sacale. — download_SM2RAIN
text: Crhistian Cornejo

title: Function to download SM2RAIN global netcdf datasets on daily sacale. — download_SM2RAIN
code: if (FALSE) { download_SM2RAIN(data_set = 'SM2RAIN-ASCAT',                 years = 2007:2010) }

text: stations_names character. Names stations want download get code. type character. Type stations codes returned. get_LongLat logical. TRUE Longitude Latitude added output dataframe. needed plotStations function. plotStations logical. TRUE plot graph ubications stations altitude.

title: Function to get codes of senamhi water stations. — get_codes
text: functions make usefull easy wrangling download data package senamhiR source("https://gitlab.com/snippets/1793256/raw");install("senamhiR")

title: Function to get codes of senamhi water stations. — get_codes
text: Crhistian Cornejo

title: Function to get codes of senamhi water stations. — get_codes
code: if (FALSE) { #example for get the codes and pre-process for get_SENAMHI_data function if return is a list names <- c('Asuncion','Augusto','llica','honda','llagaden',            'namora','jesus','la victoria','celendin') codes <- get_codes(stations_names = names,                   type = 'Met',                   get_LongLat = TRUE,                   plotStations = TRUE)   codes_for_function <- do.call(rbind, lapply(codes[1], data.frame, stringsAsFactors=FALSE)) %>%  dplyr::arrange(StationID) %>%  dplyr::select(StationID) %>%  purrr::as_vector()   }

what:
Obtain information from SENAMHI on Advanced Thermo-Pluviometric information from existing stations, this information is available from 2011 to the present.

You can quickly generate an Exploratory Data Analysis for the entire requested data set. — get_ITPA_SENAMHI

Compute fast Exploratory Data Analysis information.

title:
Obtain information from SENAMHI on Advanced Thermo-Pluviometric information from existing stations, this information is available from 2011 to the present.
You can quickly generate an Exploratory Data Analysis for the entire requested data set. — get_ITPA_SENAMHI
text: fast_EDA TRUE return list several information form SENAMHI ITPA, firts list: 'list[[1]]' tibble information stations request, second list: 'list[[2]]', results fast Exploratory Data ANALYSIS variables tibble. Also export .csv file local home working directory.

title:
Obtain information from SENAMHI on Advanced Thermo-Pluviometric information from existing stations, this information is available from 2011 to the present.
You can quickly generate an Exploratory Data Analysis for the entire requested data set. — get_ITPA_SENAMHI
code: if (FALSE) { if(interactive()){ station <- c('AUGUSTO WEBERBAUER', 'NAMORA') test <- get_ITPA_SENAMHI(year_filter = '2011',                         station = station,                         export_csv = TRUE,                         fast_EDA = TRUE)  tabla_senamhi <- as_tibble(test[[1]]) missing_values <- test[[3]]  } }

what: Get information from multiple station and variables from Servicio Nacional de Meteorología e Hidrológia del Perú (SENAMHI). — get_SENAMHI_data
title: Get information from multiple station and variables from Servicio Nacional de Meteorología e Hidrológia del Perú (SENAMHI). — get_SENAMHI_data
text: Get information multiple station variables Servicio Nacional de Meteorología e Hidrológia del Perú (SENAMHI).

title: Get information from multiple station and variables from Servicio Nacional de Meteorología e Hidrológia del Perú (SENAMHI). — get_SENAMHI_data
code: get_SENAMHI_data(   cod = NULL,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   convert2monthly = FALSE,   convert2daily = FALSE,   na.rm = T,   vars = c("pr", "tmp", "wind") )

title: Get information from multiple station and variables from Servicio Nacional de Meteorología e Hidrológia del Perú (SENAMHI). — get_SENAMHI_data
text: cod character. Codes station want download, see codes use link{get_codes}. moment just Conventional stations data available. start_date character. Start date filter data want download. Please write 'yyyy-mm-dd'. end_date character. End date filter data want download. Please write 'yyyy-mm-dd'. convert2monthly logical.TRUE return data monthly values. convert2daily logical. TRUE return data daily values (just works precipitation data). na.rm logical. TRUE remove NA's values data convert2monthly TRUE. FALSE return monthly mean values convert2monthly NA's. vars character. Variables found database SEAMHI return.

title: Get information from multiple station and variables from Servicio Nacional de Meteorología e Hidrológia del Perú (SENAMHI). — get_SENAMHI_data
text: matrix station data variable request, values precipitation (mm/hour, mm/day), temperature values (°C) wind data direction velocity unit (m/s)

title: Get information from multiple station and variables from Servicio Nacional de Meteorología e Hidrológia del Perú (SENAMHI). — get_SENAMHI_data
text: functions make usefull easy wrangling download data package senamhiR source("https://gitlab.com/snippets/1793256/raw");install("senamhiR")

title: Get information from multiple station and variables from Servicio Nacional de Meteorología e Hidrológia del Perú (SENAMHI). — get_SENAMHI_data
text: Crhistian Cornejo

title: Get information from multiple station and variables from Servicio Nacional de Meteorología e Hidrológia del Perú (SENAMHI). — get_SENAMHI_data
code: if (FALSE) { #example for get the codes and pre-process for get_SENAMHI_data function names <- c('Asuncion','Augusto','llica', 'honda','llagaden','namora', 'jesus','la victoria','celendin') codes <- get_codes(stations_names = names,                   type = 'Meteorological',                   get_LongLat = TRUE,                   plotStations = TRUE)   codes_for_function <- do.call(rbind, lapply(codes[1], data.frame,  stringsAsFactors=FALSE)) %>%  dplyr::arrange(StationID) %>%  dplyr::select(StationID) %>%  purrr::as_vector() #for temperature Data_T <- get_SENAMHI_data(cod = codes_for_function,                           start_date = '2000-01-01',                           end_date = '2015-12-31',                           convert2monthly = FALSE,                           convert2daily = FALSE,                           na.rm = FALSE,                           vars = 'tmp') #getting the names matching names as vector for replace on the export real_names <- do.call(rbind, lapply(codes[1], data.frame, stringsAsFactors=FALSE)) %>%  dplyr::filter(StationID %in%  codes_for_function) %>%  dplyr::arrange(StationID) %>%  dplyr::select(1) %>% as.data.frame() %>% purrr::as_vector(.)  nombres_est <- as.vector(real_names) colnames(Data_T) <- c('Date',rep(paste0('tmax_',nombres_est),1), rep(paste0('tmin_',nombres_est),1)) #for precipitation Data_P <- get_SENAMHI_data(cod = codes_for_function,                           start_date = '2000-01-01',                           end_date = '2015-12-31',                           convert2monthly = FALSE,                           convert2daily = FALSE,                           na.rm = FALSE,                           vars = 'pr') #getting the names matching names as vector for replace on the export of precipitation dataframe real_names_p <- do.call(rbind, lapply(codes[1], data.frame, stringsAsFactors=FALSE)) %>%  dplyr::filter(StationID %in% codes_for_function) %>%  dplyr::arrange(StationID) %>% dplyr::select(1) %>% as.data.frame() %>% purrr::as_vector(.)  nombres_est_p <- as.vector(real_names_p) colnames(Data_P) <- c('Date',rep(paste0('Prec07_',nombres_est),1),rep(paste0('Prec19_',nombres_est),1)) write.csv(Data_P, '../SENAMHI_Prec_2000_2015_subdaily.csv') }

what:
Function extracts grid data from climate raster bricks
and make a database table for later import in RSMinerve platform. — grid2RSMinerve
title:
Function extracts grid data from climate raster bricks
and make a database table for later import in RSMinerve platform. — grid2RSMinerve
text: Function extracts grid data climate raster bricks make database table later import RSMinerve platform.

title:
Function extracts grid data from climate raster bricks
and make a database table for later import in RSMinerve platform. — grid2RSMinerve
code: grid2RSMinerve(   grid,   subbasins,   var_type = "Precipitation",   crs = 32717,   DEM,   dsn = getwd(),   dates_rs = list(),   interpolation_method = "Linear",   cores = parallel::detectCores() - 1 )

title:
Function extracts grid data from climate raster bricks
and make a database table for later import in RSMinerve platform. — grid2RSMinerve
text: grid raster brick raster stack subbasins PARAM_DESCRIPTION var_type Either 'Temperature' 'Precipitation'.Default: 'Precipitation' crs 4 digit crs code ensure projection consistency raster shapefile. Default: 32717 DEM Digitial Elevation Model (raster) extracting z values. dsn path directory want store downloaded data. dates_rs list star_date end_date raster brick information, Default: list() interpolation_method type interpolation reading RSMinerve, Default: 'Linear' cores numeric. Number cores used download. default, automatically detects many cores computer subtracts 1 prevent slowing .

title:
Function extracts grid data from climate raster bricks
and make a database table for later import in RSMinerve platform. — grid2RSMinerve
code: if (FALSE) { if(interactive()){ DEM <- raster::raster('usefull_data/pruebas/DEM_alos_JT.tif') subbasins <- sf::st_read('usefull_data/pruebas/Subcuencas_v006.shp') grid_pr <- raster::brick('usefull_data/pruebas/prec_diaria.nc')  grid2RSMinerve(grid = grid_pr,                subbasins = subbasins,                var_type = 'Precipitation',                crs = 32717,DEM = DEM,                dsn = getwd(),                interpolation_method = 'Linear',                dates_rs = list(Start = '1981-01-01', end = '2016-12-31'))  } }

what: Function to extract Precipitation grid data from daily and make inputs for SWAT model — grid_pcp2SWAT
title: Function to extract Precipitation grid data from daily and make inputs for SWAT model — grid_pcp2SWAT

title: Function to extract Precipitation grid data from daily and make inputs for SWAT model — grid_pcp2SWAT
code: grid_pcp2SWAT(   pr = NULL,   Subbasins = NULL,   DEM = NULL,   cores = parallel::detectCores() - 1,   Star_Date = "1981-01-01",   Temporal = "day",   dsn = getwd() )

title: Function to extract Precipitation grid data from daily and make inputs for SWAT model — grid_pcp2SWAT
text: pr brick stack raster/netcdf grid format precipitation. Subbasins SpatialPolygonDataFrame object subbasins generated SWAT model. DEM Raster .tif format Digital Elevation Model used hydrological model. cores numeric. Number cores used download. default, automatically detects many cores computer subtracts 1 prevent slowing . Star_Date character. Initial date extract information. Temporal character. 'day' aceptting swat, want extract monthly data, write 'month' dsn path. Directory want store downloaded data.

title: Function to extract Precipitation grid data from daily and make inputs for SWAT model — grid_pcp2SWAT
code: if (FALSE) {  DEM <- raster::raster('Data/GRIDs/DEM.tif') pr <- 'Data/GRIDs/prec_diaria.nc' Subbasins <- rgdal::readOGR('Data/SHPs/subs.shp') Star_Date = '1981-01-01' Temporal = 'day'  grid_pcp2SWAT(   pr = pr,   Subbasins = Subbasins,  DEM = DEM,   Star_Date = '1981-01-01',   Temporal = 'day' )  }

title: Function to extract Temperature grid data from daily and make inputs for SWAT model — grid_tas2SWAT
text: tx brick stack raster/netcdf grid format maximun temperature. tn brick stack raster/netcdf grid format minimun temperature. Subbasins SpatialPolygonDataFrame object subbasins generated SWAT model. DEM Raster .tif format Digital Elevation Model used hydrological model. cores numeric. Number cores used download. default, automatically detects many cores computer subtracts 1 prevent slowing . Star_Date character. Initial date extract information. Temporal character. 'day' aceptting swat, want extract monthly data, write 'month' dsn path. Directory want store downloaded data.

title: Function to extract Temperature grid data from daily and make inputs for SWAT model — grid_tas2SWAT
text: Crhistian Cornejo

title: Function to extract Temperature grid data from daily and make inputs for SWAT model — grid_tas2SWAT
code: if (FALSE) { DEM <- raster::raster('Data/GRIDs/DEM.tif') tx <- 'Data/GRIDs/tmax_diaria.nc' tn <- 'Data/GRIDs/tmin_diaria.nc' Subbasins <- rgdal::readOGR('Data/SHPs/subs.shp') Star_Date = '1981-01-01' Temporal = 'day' grid_tas2SWAT (  tx = tx,  tn = tn,  Subbasins = Subbasins,  DEM = DEM,  Star_Date = '1981-01-01',  Temporal = 'day')   }

Default: 'UTC'. units units observed data, Default: c("C", "mm/d", "m3/s"). save_path string path csv output saved, Default: getwd(). interpolation_method string name interpolation method use NA's values PET RS Minerve, Default: 'Linear'. dates_rs list start end date generate dates RS minerve can read, Default: list(Start = "2007-01-01", end = "2010-12-31")

title: Function to subset and aggregate TERRACLIMATE netcdfs and exported the stack as tif. — subsseting_TERRACLIMATE
code: subsseting_TERRACLIMATE(   vars_id = c("aet", "def", "swe", "q", "soil", "PDSI", "pet", "ppt", "srad", "tmax",     "tmin", "vap", "vpd", "ws"),   dsn = getwd(),   shapefile = NULL,   years_sub = 1958:1960,   factor = 0.1,   aggr_mean_yearly = FALSE,   export_tif_stack = TRUE,   Rcolorbrewer_pal = "Greens" )

title: Function to subset and aggregate TERRACLIMATE netcdfs and exported the stack as tif. — subsseting_TERRACLIMATE
text: vars_id character. Name variables want subsetting. DEFAULT make subset variables donwload folder create link{download_TERRACLIMATE}. dsn character. Path output folders files saved, Default: getwd() shapefile SpatialPolygonDataFrame. Shapefile make clip, obligatory introduce, Default: NULL years_sub integer. Years want subset, DEFAULT available years TERRACLIMATE download data link{download_TERRACLIMATE}., Default: 1958:1960 factor numeric. Scale factor multiplied netcdf values, Default: 0.1 aggr_mean_yearly logical. TRUE want return multianual aggregate raster variable(s). FALSE return raster brick subsetting, Default: FALSE. export_tif_stack logical. TRUE want export raster stack subsetting, FALSE return just raster brick, Default: TRUE. Rcolorbrewer_pal character. Name Rcolorbrewer palet yout want plot, Default: 'Greens'

title: Function to subset and aggregate TERRACLIMATE netcdfs and exported the stack as tif. — subsseting_TERRACLIMATE
text: Subsettings exported raster tifs.

title: Function to subset and aggregate TERRACLIMATE netcdfs and exported the stack as tif. — subsseting_TERRACLIMATE
text: Abatzoglou, J.T., S.Z. Dobrowski, S.. Parks, K.C. Hegewisch, 2018, Terraclimate, high-resolution global dataset monthly climate climatic water balance 1958-2015, Scientific Data,

title: Function to subset and aggregate TERRACLIMATE netcdfs and exported the stack as tif. — subsseting_TERRACLIMATE
text: Crhistian Cornejo#'

title: Function to subset and aggregate TERRACLIMATE netcdfs and exported the stack as tif. — subsseting_TERRACLIMATE
code: if (FALSE) { if(interactive()){ SHP <- rgdal::readOGR('Data/SHPs/subs.shp') rst <- subsseting_TERRACLIMATE(vars_id = 'ppt',                               shapefile = SHP,                               years_sub = 2000:2002,                               factor = 0.1,                               aggr_mean_yearly = FALSE,                               export_tif_stack = TRUE,                               Rcolorbrewer_pal = 'Blues')     } }
